plan_analysis:
The forecaster must judge whether H.R. 33 will finish the entire legislative process (both chambers + president + publication) in only 63 days.  Key missing knowledge:

1. Current state and momentum  
   • Where exactly is H.R. 33 now? (House passage? Senate companion? Committee referral? Planned floor action?)  
   • Does leadership (Senate Finance Committee, Majority/Minority leaders, White House) support fast-tracking it?  
   • Is there an alternative vehicle (e.g., being folded into a broader tax package or a CR) scheduled before May 1?

2. Base rate / historical precedent  
   • How often do stand-alone bilateral tax-relief bills (or low-number priority bills) become law, especially within ~60 days of the end of April?  
   • Overall success rate and typical time-to-passage for House-passed bills during the 2nd session of recent Congresses.  
   • Success rate for bills referred to Senate Finance that emerge and pass quickly.

3. Key drivers / obstacles  
   • Congressional schedule between now and May 1 (recesses, must-pass vehicles).  
   • Any organized opposition or “holds” in the Senate, or Administration concerns.  
   • Whether the bill’s content could instead be implemented by treaty/executive agreement, reducing urgency.

4. Contrarian evidence  
   • Indications the Senate may attach the text to a large must-pass bill (e.g., FAA re-authorization, tax extenders), raising the chance of enactment despite time pressure.  
   • Signs of partisan gridlock or unrelated hostage-taking that could stall all tax legislation.

The existing context gives none of this, so the search strategy needs to surface: (a) live status pages and news coverage for H.R. 33 and any Senate counterpart; (b) historical enactment statistics for comparable bills; (c) congressional calendar and legislative vehicle information; (d) commentary from tax-policy outlets and Taiwan-US relations analysts that could reveal insider expectations.

queries_planned.query: House bills double taxation foreign country became law
queries_planned.intent: Find past stand-alone foreign double-tax bills that successfully became law to build a reference class and frequency.

queries_planned.query: enactment rate House passed bills 117th 118th Congress
queries_planned.intent: Gather statistics on what share of House-passed bills became law recently for baseline probability.

queries_planned.query: Senate Finance committee reported bills time to enact
queries_planned.intent: Identify typical lag from committee report to final enactment for Finance-related tax legislation.
Determine available legislative days before May 1 for floor action in each chamber.

queries_planned.query: Among U.S. bills addressing foreign double taxation relief since 2000, how many were enacted and what was the median days from introduction to becoming Public Law?
queries_planned.intent: Produce quantified base-rate data and timeline distribution for comparable legislation.
Get the latest procedural position of H.R. 33 and whether a Senate version exists.

queries_planned.query: “United States–Taiwan Expedited Double-Tax Relief Act” prospects 2026
queries_planned.intent: Surface expert commentary and analysis about likelihood and pathways for enactment before May 1.

queries_planned.query: Senate Finance Chair Wyden Taiwan tax bill comments 2026
queries_planned.intent: Find statements from key gatekeepers indicating support, scheduling, or obstacles, serving as leading indicators.
